meanings.definition: The quality or state of being irrelevant.
meanings.sent1: The teacher ignored the student's irrelevances during the class discussion.
meanings.sent2: Please focus on the main points and avoid unnecessary irrelevances.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to join the dog's playtime was an irrelevance that amused everyone.
meanings.sent4: In the grand scheme of things, his complaints seemed like tiny irrelevances.
meanings.sent5: The bright red umbrella in the sea of black suits was an irrelevance that caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: Things that are not relevant or applicable.
meanings.sent1: She cleared her desk of all the irrelevances before starting the important project.
meanings.sent2: The report highlighted the irrelevances that needed to be addressed for better results.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing trash can in the office was an irrelevance that needed immediate attention.
meanings.sent4: His outdated opinions were seen as irrelevances in the modern discussion.
meanings.sent5: The unnecessary details in the presentation were distracting irrelevances that took away from the main message.
